dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kanye West's presidential run is like a bizarre political remix, you know, where the beats don't quite line up and the lyrics keep contradicting themselves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kanye West's presidential run is like a bizarre political remix, you know, where the beats don't quite line up and the lyrics keep contradicting themselves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's reporting that he's running to win, but then he says he's actually running to lose? That's, uh, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's reporting that he's running to win, but then he says he's actually running to lose? That's, uh, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about that directly, West said that rather than running for president, he was walking, quickly adding that he was walking . . . to win.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he's doing it to support Donald Trump, even though Trump himself said, "I don't like Kanye very much."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he's doing it to support Donald Trump, even though Trump himself said, I don't like Kanye very much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I like Kanye very much, President Trump told reporters at the White House yesterday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and then there's this whole thing about him meeting with Mike Pence about a post-Covid curriculum? Like, what does that even mean?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and then there's this whole thing about him meeting with Mike Pence about a post-Covid curriculum? Like, what does that even mean?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: West says that hes designing a school within the next month and that Im meeting with Betsy DeVos about the post-Covid curriculum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's so all over the place. And then he's got this "Birthday Party" platform with pro-choice stances and Wakanda-inspired management.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's so all over the place. And then he's got this Birthday Party platform with pro-choice stances and Wakanda-inspired management.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a wide-ranging interview with Forbes last month about his political aspirations, West, who has never voted before, laid out a platform for his Birthday Party that included a pro-life plank that alleged that Planned Parenthood was placed in cities by white supremacists, a management style patterned on the fictional country of Wakanda in Black Panther and anti-vaccine conspiracy theories.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet he was texting 'Biden 2020' earlier this summer! The inconsistency is just… baffling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet he was texting 'Biden twenty twenty' earlier this summer! The inconsistency is just... baffling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Texts from West to me earlier this summer repeatedly ended with the sign-off Trump 2020, and a fist raised high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, the reports from Fox News and Breitbart say Democratic operatives are helping get him on ballots in key states like California.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, the reports from Fox News and Breitbart say Democratic operatives are helping get him on ballots in key states like California.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wests intentions have come under increased scrutiny this week, following reports by CNN, New York, the New York Times and others, about efforts by GOP political operatives to get him onto several ballots, including states like Wisconsin that could be pivotal in deciding the next president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which feels super strategic, right? Like maybe it's meant to siphon votes from Trump?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which feels super strategic, right? Like maybe it's meant to siphon votes from Trump?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kanye West Amid various reports that Republican and Trump-affiliated political operatives are trying to get Kanye West onto various state ballots for Novembers presidential election, the billionaire rap superstar indicated, in an interview by text today, that he was in fact running to siphon votes from the presumptive Democratic nominee, Joe Biden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But when asked if he feels used, Kanye just calls it a 'God production.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But when asked if he feels used, Kanye just calls it a 'God production.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: West did not respond when asked whether he feels hes being used. When I pointed out to West that the slapdash operation to get him on the ballot, which includes one operative previously arrested for voter fraud and multiple West electors from the same address, didnt feel like a Kanye West production, West replied that it was a God production.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he praised Biden in that Breitbart interview too—said he was 'putting the blue hat on.' It's like he's playing all sides.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he praised Biden in that Breitbart interview too-said he was 'putting the blue hat on.' It's like he's playing all sides.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In that interview, West also claimed that he was dumping Trump. I am taking the red hat off, with this interview.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then he criticizes Trump for not allowing God in the conversation? The man's messaging is a total rollercoaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then he criticizes Trump for not allowing God in the conversation? The man's messaging is a total rollercoaster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump is the closest president weve had in years to allowing God to still be part of the conversation, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, I can't tell if it's genius trolling or just complete chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, I can't tell if it's genius trolling or just complete chaos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Either way, it's definitely shaping up to be one of the weirdest subplots of this election cycle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Either way, it's definitely shaping up to be one of the weirdest subplots of this election cycle.

artist_script:
HostA: Kanye West's presidential run is like a bizarre political remix, you know, where the beats don't quite line up and the lyrics keep contradicting themselves.
HostB: Yeah, and he's reporting that he's running to win, but then he says he's actually running to lose? That's, uh, pretty wild.
HostA: Right, and he's doing it to support Donald Trump, even though Trump himself said, "I don't like Kanye very much."
HostB: Mhm, and then there's this whole thing about him meeting with Mike Pence about a post-Covid curriculum? Like, what does that even mean?
HostA: It’s so all over the place. And then he’s got this "Birthday Party" platform with pro-choice stances and Wakanda-inspired management.
HostB: And yet he was texting "Biden 2020" earlier this summer! The inconsistency is just… baffling.
HostA: Plus, the reports from Fox News and Breitbart say Democratic operatives are helping get him on ballots in key states like California.
HostB: Which feels super strategic, right? Like maybe it's meant to siphon votes from Trump?
HostA: Exactly. But when asked if he feels used, Kanye just calls it a "God production."
HostB: And he praised Biden in that Breitbart interview too—said he was "putting the blue hat on." It's like he's playing all sides.
HostA: But then he criticizes Trump for not allowing God in the conversation? The man’s messaging is a total rollercoaster.
HostB: Honestly, I can't tell if it's genius trolling or just complete chaos.
HostA: Either way, it’s definitely shaping up to be one of the weirdest subplots of this election cycle.
